intro: Hiptage benghalensis f. longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved hiptage, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves that can grow up to 20 cm in length. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It is native to tropical regions of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. The plant is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
